content:
Hi Lin,

I went from 145 to 140esr a month ago. All I did was delete compatibility.ini. I don't know if I should have done more. I have not had any problems.

I have looked a little and have not found mention of specific concerns when moving backward within the 14x versions.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Thank you. Maybe I was thinking of Firefox, or some earlier major version jump. As long as I have a good copy of the profile I guess I have nothing to lose.

Here I go. Geronimo!

content: Oh, yeah, back up first, of course. I should have said that too. Would you please report if you have problems?

content: Did you install 140 right over 145, or did you uninstall 145 first?
creator: rednoise

content: I did not uninstall. Didn't even think of it. I use a Macintosh. I'm not aware that Thunderbird stores anything other than the application file and profiles. I believe that it stores more files in different locations on Windows.
creator: mozilla98

content:
I did it. Everything seems to work as expected. I have my notification sounds back. I did have to re-enter all my passwords. Thanks, again, for your help.

I see a couple of mentions of what I think is the same notification sounds bug, which doesn't appear to have been addressed yet. I should probably report it, but the Bugzilla process looks complicated and tedious. I just don't have the time for that right now.
creator: rednoise

content:
Il tuo racconto non è coerente, sbagli qualcosa. Se usi POP3 allora la Posta inviata si trova direttamente in Thunderbird NON va scaricata dal server.

Oppure prova a spiegare meglio la tua configurazione e le azioni che compi.
creator: @next

content: Per farla breve, non ho specificato che per la casella in questione uso Thunderbird solo per fare i backup e non per inviare la posta (operazione che faccio sul pannello web). L'unico modo che ho con POP3 per scaricarmi massivamente la "Posta inviata", non potendo usare IMAP, è travasare i messaggi inviati nella "Posta in arrivo" e poi sincronizzare Thunderbird
creator: Ffrreennggoo

content: Allora devi chiedere a Google come gestisce le date. Thunderbird ti mostra come data quella di download solo quando trova una email senza data o con data non corretta. In ogni caso è completamente difforme alle specifiche POP3, non penso proprio si possa parlare di bug. Se comunque volessi segnalarlo lo puoi fare qui -> https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/
creator: @next

content: "Ошибка входа на сервер «imap.web.de» с именем пользователя...."
creator: modifiga

content:
TRANSLATION

I keep getting a message about losing connection to the servers

"Login error to the server 'imap.web.de' with username...."

__________

Узнайте у своего поставщика услуг электронной почты, какими должны быть настройки входящего и исходящего серверов. Вам понадобится следующая информация:

имя сервера порт метод безопасности соединения метод аутентификации имя пользователя

Затем убедитесь, что все настройки в Thunderbird верны. Настройки входящего сервера находятся в разделе «Параметры учётной записи» > «Параметры сервера». Настройки исходящего сервера находятся в разделе «Параметры учётной записи» > нажмите на имя учётной записи > «Изменить SMTP-сервер».

__________

Find out from your e-mail service provider what the incoming server settings and outgoing server settings should be. You will need this information:

server name port connection security method authentication method username

Then ensure that all the settings in Thunderbird are correct. Incoming server settings are in account settings > server settings. Outgoing server settings are in account settings > click on account name > edit SMTP server.
creator: mozilla98

content:
You can search in the filters file in the account’s directory in your profile.

Sorry, difficult for me to say more now. Ask if you need more help.
creator: mozilla98
